response:
I found Chip and asked him if he'd like to help me surprise the Beast with a ladder. Chip grinned, and said he'd like that a lot, but he wondered where we should start. "Right here," I said and pulled a big book about woodworking off of a shelf. I explained that with so many books, I knew we could learn to fix a lot of things. According to the woodworking book, we needed lumber, a saw, a hammer, and some nails to build a ladder. Luckily, there was plenty of wood and a box of tools in the barn. I changed into a work dress. Then, with Chip's help, I measured and sawed and nailed until we had built a ladder that was even sturdier and taller than the last one. "Just wait till the Beast sees this!" I exclaimed. We showed it to the Beast. He was surprised and pleased, but he still seemed a little grumpy. Everyone else was very happy, though. Lumiere, Cogsworth, and Mrs. Potts all marveled at our ladder. Cogsworth even declared it, "excellent craftsmanship!"
I hope you've enjoyed the story so far. Would you like to hear the next part?
